item.title: Kinematics
item.description: The Observation Let’s say that, for whatever reason, you decide to stand on a very tall (but totally safe) ladder, drop a ball, and time how long the ball takes to hit the ground. Jotting down this height in meters and time in seconds, you climb to another rung on the ladder and repeat the process a couple of more times. After ten such drops, you’ll have a data table that looks something like this (give or take, given your reaction time)
